Desc.eng: Inquisitor, how socially proactive of you to visit me.
How? You said it was a classified investigation.

I am the Fabricator-General of a Forge Word. I have my methods. I have an informant in the retinue of the Inquisitor in charge, stationed on the ship of a certain Captain van Wynter. We could both benefit from the Archeotech secrets in that monastery.
I will accept your offer, Fabricator-General. I will travel to the coordinates of the “Martyr” immediately.
You contacted me and promised me information.

A straightforward approach. Most commendable. I accessed the digital scrolls on your non-classified investigations and noticed the main object of your interest, and this was confirmed by your recent visit to the Sanctum.
What dominant interest are you referring to?
You are actively seeking Tech-Relics of Uther Tiberius, the infamous Inquisitor excommunicated for potentially heretical studies. I have information that could significantly advance your pursuit.
Are you offering me additional information on the Xenarite sect?

That sect was terminated a long time ago on. I have more valuable information for you. The “Martyr”, the wandering fortress-monastery of Uther Tiberius, long thought to be lost, has returned to the Caligari Sector from the Immaterium.
A thorough study of the ship could reward me with precious inormation.

The problem is that the “Martyr” is currently under a highly classified Inquisitorial investigation, which even I have no word on. Your credentials, on the other hand, would grant you access. I have the current coordinates of the ship.
